ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. It is a good survey and an opportunity to have real discussions with other people interested in the material.
Yes, definitely. This is one of the best courses I've taken with senior fellows. The readings are also very interesting.

Incredible course. Learned an amazing amount from Professor Ford. His understanding of Arab politics goes beyond anything you'll learn in a book or any other course on the Middle East and North Africa at Yale. Also Ford is just a badass all around. Take it.

Really good overview of Arab politics, good blend of history + present. I liked that we had a lot of flexibility in terms of assignments - it really allows you to go deep on topics you're interested in.
The class makes you think a lot, especially tying together historical events and themes. Don't take it unless you're willing to do a lot of reading.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provided a good historical/ policy foundation to understanding the Arab world. The scope is broad but I didn't feel like we covered the topics in a superficial way.
